title: jeemomart
author: jeemomart
content: Hi,I am using 5x3060ti plugged in with Esonic Gladiator HM65-Gladiators Combo Motherboard for GPU mining with nicehash. It does have internal graphic display and i have plugged in HDMI from Motherboard to my Smart TV to see intial mining display.While booting up with NiceHash OS USB driver. i am getting a warning message.Warning: Onboard GPU card detected. Please disable onboard GPU card in bios settings.When i go to bios and disable internal display. I notice that it does not show the display and even mining not starting in "Rig manager" of nicehash dashboard. When i go ahead and start mining with "internal display: Enabled" in bios setting. After few hours of mining i am getting an error.Cuda Error: out of memory (err_no=2)Device 1 exception, exit.....This error effect the mining profits directly. Is there anyone facing the same issues and have any solution?Please help.

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: There's no reason not to use the iGPU, in fact it's desireable to avoid burdoning a mining GPU with the display.The GPU crash is a different issue and needs troubleshooting. Did it happen only once? Same GPU? Try swapping components.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Post a link to your question in this threadhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=562238.6920I use Hive OS and there are no such problems. This error occurs when the video card does not have enough internal memory for operations, but it's hard for me to say about the reasons for this error.Look at what devices the miner uses, manual disable may be possible.
